Detailed Description

The OSMMap class holds all nodes, ways and relations representing an area.

Definition at line 35 of file osmmap.cpp.

OSMNode * OSMMap::getNodePtrById ( int  id  ) 

Returns pointer to the node with the ID specified. Unlike node(), this function matches the specified id to OSMNode::m_id rather than the position in the list. This function is used primarily to add a node to a way or relation, be aware that, as it is a pointer, any changes made to the returned object will be relflected in the OSMMap object.

See also:
nodes()

node( int )

Parameters:
id The id of the node to return
Returns:
A pointer to the requested OSMNode

Definition at line 24 of file osmmap.cpp.

Referenced by OSMRelation::getMemberNode().

OSMRelation * OSMMap::getRelationPtrById ( int  id  ) 

Returns pointer to the relation with the ID specified. Unlike relation(), this function matches the specified id to OSMRelation::m_id rather than the position in the list. This function is used primarily to add a relation to another relation, be aware that, as it is a pointer, any changes made to the returned object will be relflected in the OSMMap object.

See also:
relations()

relation( int )

Parameters:
id The id of the relation to return
Returns:
A pointer to the requested OSMRelation

Definition at line 76 of file osmmap.cpp.

OSMWay * OSMMap::getWayPtrById ( int  id  ) 

Returns pointer to the way with the ID specified. Unlike way(), this function matches the specified id to OSMWay::m_id rather than the position in the list. This function is used primarily to add a way to a relation, be aware that, as it is a pointer, any changes made to the returned object will be relflected in the OSMMap object.

See also:
ways()

id The id of the way to return

OSMNode OSMMap::node ( int  id  ) 

Return the node at position id in the list of nodes. Equivalent to nodes().at( id ).

See also:
nodes()

id The position of the node within the QList

Definition at line 19 of file osmmap.cpp.

QList< OSMNode > OSMMap::nodes (  ) 

Return all nodes in the map as a QList. Be aware that for large maps, this list can be very large, so take care when using. Use getNodePtrById( int ) or node( int ) if you need just one node.

See also:
getNodePtrById( int )

node( int )

Returns:
A QList<OSMNode> containing all the nodes in the map

Definition at line 71 of file osmmap.cpp.

QList< OSMRelation > OSMMap::relations (  ) 

Return all relations in the map as a QList. Be aware that for large maps, this list can be very large, so take care when using. Use getRelationPtrById( int ) or relation( int ) if you need just one node.

See also:
getRelationPtrById( int )

relation( int )

Returns:
A QList<OSMNode> containing all the relations in the map

Definition at line 45 of file osmmap.cpp.

QList< OSMWay > OSMMap::ways (  ) 

Return all ways in the map as a QList. Be aware that for large maps, this list can be very large, so take care when using. Use getWayPtrById( int ) or way( int ) if you need just one node.

See also:
getWayPtrById( int )

way( int )

Returns:
A QList<OSMWay> containing all the ways in the map
